item.title: Python Blog Post
item.description: library(reticulate) Hi there! In this blog post, I will be using regex to look for objects in strings, a very useful tool in genetics research. import re #Naming string with IUPAC conventions for genes string1="" #Matching restriction enzyme binding sites ANTAAT and GCRWTG re.findall(r'(A.TAAT)|(GC[A|G][A|T]TG)', string1) #ANT\AAT restriction enzyme cut ## [('', 'GCGTTG'), ('ATTAAT', ''), ('', 'GCAATG'), ('ACTAAT', '')] list1=re.split(r'(.+A.T)(AAT.+)', string1) len(list1) ## 4
